definition: Xue Ji (649-713), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
surname Xue/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
wormwood like grass (classical)
millet/God of cereals worshiped by ancient rulers/minister of agriculture
